snippet: For the second time since 2011, an appeals court upheld the policy at the University of Texas at Austin to consider race as a factor in some of its admissions decisions.
abstract: Editorial supports federal appeals court decision upholding affirmative action admissions at University of Texas in face of lawsuit brought by white student Abigail Fisher after she was denied admission; holds that university has made strong effort to reach workable solution to diversity effort, and has largely succeeded in doing so.
lead_paragraph: For the second time since 2011, an appeals court upheld the policy at the University of Texas at Austin to consider race as a factor in some of its admissions decisions.
